DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS 43 Adult Profile v2.0 PFB1 Current Health Limits Doing Moderate Work Around the House Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how much their health now limits them in doing moderate work around the house like vacuuming, sweeping floors or carrying in groceries, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS-43 Adult Profile v2.0 Current Health Limits Doing Moderate Work Around the House Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 43-item multidimensional and universal measure of health intended for use across a variety of conditions. It measures an adult patient's self-reported health status in seven domains: physical function, anxiety, depression, fatigue, sleep disturbance, pain interference, and participation in social roles._A question about whether an individual's health now limits them in doing moderate work around the house._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 43-item multidimensional and universal measure of health intended for use across a variety of conditions. It measures an adult patient's self-reported health status in seven domains: physical function, anxiety, depression, fatigue, sleep disturbance, pain interference, and participation in social roles.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: PROMIS Health Limitation Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used with the PROMIS items that describes a range of subjective scores for representing how much an individual is limited from doing a specific activity because of their health from 1: Cannot do, to 5: Not at all.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual cannot do something.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual cannot do something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something for the smallest amount of effort or duration of time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something for the smallest amount of effort or duration of time.
A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does your health now limit yo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does your health now limit you in doing moderate work around the house like vacuuming, sweeping floors or carrying in groceries?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for ECOG-ACRIN study in Rave per request by S. Roulliard. mc 5/5/15
